meanings.definition: In a manner that is devotedly or faithfully
meanings.sent1: She prayed religiously every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: He attends church services religiously without fail.
meanings.sent3: The cat religiously chased after the laser pointer, convinced it was real.
meanings.sent4: The detective religiously pursued the case until he found the truth.
meanings.sent5: The old man religiously watered his plants, ensuring they thrived.

meanings.sent1: She religiously brushed her teeth every morning and night.
meanings.sent2: The mailman religiously delivered letters to every house on the street.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock religiously woke him up at the same time every day.
meanings.sent4: The sun religiously rose in the east each morning, painting the sky with colors.
meanings.sent5: The student religiously reviewed his notes before every exam.

meanings.sent1: She worked religiously on her art, striving to improve every day.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained religiously, aiming to reach the Olympics.
meanings.sent3: The chef religiously tasted his dishes, ensuring they were perfect.
meanings.sent4: The teacher religiously supported her students, guiding them towards success.
meanings.sent5: The scientist religiously conducted experiments, seeking groundbreaking discoveries.
